author: Benjamin Warlick
comment: This is really a referral service for their investment advisory business.  Once you install, you will get never-ending calls and voice-mails.  They rotate phone numbers so it's not possible to block them.

author: Daniel Kang
comment: Best mobile app imho.  Mint has issues with authentication with constant txt alerts when I sign in.  Or it loses my sign in and I have to reenter it.  The addition of creating your own transaction categories makes this on feature parity.

author: A Karim Siddiqui
comment: Could you please add a feature so I can compare individual investment accounts against S&P instead of all of my portfolio?  Keep up the amazing work!

reply.author: Personal Capital Corporation
reply.content: Thanks for the props.  We have 2 factor authentication. If you go to a new device to login you will be prompted to enter a code from phone/sms/email.  You can manage currently authorized devices from settings.

author: Michael Thornton
comment: The app is ok but the Android app on my tablet doesn't offer the retirement planner. My iPhone has a scaled back version of retirement planner in the app but nothing on the tablet which I find odd. Everyone once  snd z whiled I'll have an account that won't update but the issues usually resolve themselves in a couple days.

reply.author: Personal Capital Corporation
reply.content: Thanks for the feedback! We're definitely working on adding retirement planner for Android phone and stay tuned.

author: Kenneth Roberts
comment: Horrible support, good app. Have had a ticket open for over five months about an account display issue. No one cares.

reply.author: Personal Capital Corporation
reply.content: could be an issue with the reported value of the holdings for that account, we might have the Ticker/Cusip incorrect and the pricing is off. You can email support and they will look into it.

author: Dale Talsma
comment: Does not work. Hangs up "Loading data..." and never finishes. I deleted it and reinstalled it, but still hangs up and all I can do is crash it. For me, it is useless. (Using Galaxy S7, Android 7 Nougat)

reply.author: Personal Capital Corporation
reply.content: Sorry to hear about this. Given you can't login to the app and message us via the support center, are you a new or existing user? You can also try logging in via the web and message us there so we can take a look at your account.

author: Stephanie F.
comment: Comes up just a bit short on some specifics like being able to lookup symbol tickers.
Lost one star because you can't capture screen (it's blocked) and you can't enter manual transactions.

author: Daniel Rood
comment: Can't figure out how to delete a closed account. frustrated

author: Pierre Damis
comment: Great app

author: Sean Freiburg
comment: This app was amazing, I used it all the time. But the latest release is crazy buggy. It adds extra buttons when editing accounts if you switch apps and come back. There are blank white screens when coming back to the app. I think someone really messed up the onResume callback in the activity lifecycle. Please fix this personal capital, I'll be happy to fix my review score.

reply.author: Personal Capital Corporation
reply.content: Thanks for the feedback. We believe you turned on a developer tools feature that prevents the app from running in the background. Please go into Developer options and ensure that "Don't keep activities" is turned OFF. In order for all of the functionality to work smoothly, the app should refresh in the background.

author: Craig Jacobik
comment: Overall a pretty good app. I'll update to 5 stars if PC allowed sorting the "Holdings" tab table by the columns like on the iOS version. And yes, they cold call you, to which you politely decline their advisory services, but overall it is the best investment aggregator app and platform on the market.

author: Dave H.
comment: Tried this app as Mint alternative because web reviews said so; big mistake. It's a personal financial management SERVICE, not just a simple tool. Got called right after I signed up. They wanted me to schedule a consultation with an advisor. Sure, I thought, probably just to let me know how my accounts look. Wrong! It's a financial profile interview, like the one your banker would do. Not even Fidelity or Mint calls me. Good if you're looking for a financial advisor; Bad if your just looking for simple budgeting tool.

author: Justin Sprecher
comment: I loved it, but now I can't link my progression credit union accounts. It attempts to import but says "we are having trouble updating..." I used to be able to connect 1 out of 5 tries but now it won't work at all. I submitted a ticket but haven't heard back from the company since.

reply.author: Personal Capital Corporation
reply.content: Thanks for your feedback. We checked with our support team and responded on 1/23 and they will follow up again to ensure the issue is resolved for you.

author: Terrance Donnelly
comment: Terrible. I put in needed info for banking institutions CORRECTLY and only accepted one. No patience for this, I'll find a different app.

reply.author: Personal Capital Corporation
reply.content: Sorry to hear about about the inconvenience. Which bank institutions are you trying to so we can dig into it? If you want additional help related to your account, message us directly through the support center in the app and we'll get it resolved.

author: Barry Barnhill
comment: Was great. Now it's Horrible, bad, no good program that works sporadically only occasionally. Wildly inaccurate graphs, really ridiculous.

reply.author: Personal Capital Corporation
reply.content: Thanks for feedback and sorry if it has not met your expectations. Could you tell us more about the issues? Having a little more info about the situation will help us evaluate and get the issue sorted faster. You can contact us directly through the app too with this extra info.

author: John Hawkins
comment: Linked accounts frequently stop working, requiring constant submits to support to get things working out.  Used to get much more reliable, now I don't feel it's even worth it anymore.

author: Jared Lind
comment: This app is the best at what it does, which is tracking your investments and net worth.  Would definitely recommend to anyone keeping track of their financial goals, especially because of the fact that they listen to their audience and make changes as necessary to add any support from external investment accounts. Two thumbs up!

author: quang kieu
comment: Looking for way too modify accounts or manual investment portfolio but there is none in the mobile app
Game changer! Know EXACTLY where you stand financially...every debt, every credit, every asset.
Used to be great but stopped working.

reply.author: Personal Capital Corporation
reply.content: Could you tell us more about what stopped working? Having a little more info about the situation will help us evaluate and get it sorted faster. You can contact us directly through the app too with this extra info.

author: Vincent Santiago
comment: I was going to give it 4-5 stars however I had a serious issue with an inability to take screenshots to send my wife of our financial standings. We just hit a financial milestone and wanted to share and it wouldn't let me. Very frustrating to be restricted and unable to change the setting.

I'm not sure why this is called budget software, I saw little evidence of that capability, and the fact that you can not import historical data makes this a non starter as a  replacement for software like Quicken.  More problematic was the next day call phone call and dozen emails I got hawking their services.  It's a nicely constructed look forward program with some decent analytics, but the sales machine behind it is not worth the free software. I've already deleted my account after several days.

author: henry lee
comment: Very good app, one of the best.  Sometimes bank/investment accts get disconnected and need updating. Before it would log in easily with PIN or fingerprint but about 3 weeks ago it needed email verif , then captcha verif  then fingerprint.  Very annoying.

author: Fred Malory
comment: Lord! They called me for a free consultation, which I said yes to and scheduled a week out. I was called and emailed 10 times to remind and confirm, ended up never taking the meeting because they pestered me.

author: Steven Tobar
comment: Great app! It's so much better for tracking than the way I was doing it with YNAB. It would be perfect if the app included Upcoming Bills for Linked Accounts like the way it does on the desktop site. I'd give it an instant 5-stars if it included that!

author: Jeff Miller
comment: I like the app, but got an unsolicited phone call from the company after installing the app. I dont recall giving permission to call my phone. Edit: changed to one star. Install this app and you'll get cold called. Had to tell them to put me on do not call list. YOUVE BEEN WARNED. AVOID.

author: Shufan Wang
comment: They will keep on calling you to discuss your financial strategy. If you don't want someone else to look at your asset and trying to make a profit out of it, stay away from this app.

author: Mark J
comment: Overall one of the best apps to link and view all my investment accounts from multiple brokers. Only think I would like is a better way to customize the "Holdings" view. On my Galaxy S7, the share price of my fund is cutoff. It would be nice to have a watch list type of view where I can see more pertinent data for each ticker I own.

author: Gina L
comment: Started to ask for email submission and image captcha every time I log in for the past 2 weeks. The additional steps defeat the whole purpose of using pin number for quick access.

reply.author: Personal Capital Corporation
reply.content: From time to time we will challenge users who are logging in from other countries.  We remember the login device if it is on the same ip address for a period of time but if you are traveling you may be challenged more frequently than you would like.

author: Steve Montgomery
comment: App crashes when trying to enter 4 digit verification code. Can't switch from text app to PC app.

author: kyle contorno
comment: I signed up with a friend's link, that promised I would receive $20 once u linked a qualifying investment account.  I linked my fidelity account and still have received nothing...

reply.author: Personal Capital Corporation
reply.content: you can email referrals AT personalcapital DOT com to get an update on your gift card status.

author: Jeremy LaFrance
comment: Requires a 4 digit code to get started. I've waited and waited for the code. Tried text and email, it never came through. I tried through the app and online, never came through.

author: George Pitman
comment: Don't use personal capital unless you like having people call your phone and harass you to accept their "financial advice".

author: Steve Moses
comment: Just started using, Quicken wasn't getting all my accounts. This does.

author: Matt Moser
comment: They called and emailed me over and over even after requests for them to not contact me.

author: Abu Idakwoji
comment: Great app but the log in needs to be upgraded

author: logan trout
comment: I think your life savors and good sent. Thank you whoever you are for being two really amazing people. Amen

author: Sharie Jackson
comment: Not what I needed.

author: Stephen Weckesser
comment: Love the app, but it needs to evolve. Needs a section for crypto!!!
